body.p: The visual editor includes a variety of features that were designed specifically for DITA Map document types. Most of these features can be accessed through actions available on the DITA Map framework-specific toolbar or from the contextual menu.

section.title: DITA Map New Document Templates
section.p: includes a variety of predefined new document templates that make it easy to create various types of DITA documents with some of the document structure already present. When you use the New button in the Dashboard for your particular file repository, a dialog box is displayed where you can choose from various types of new document templates, including Map, Bookmap, Subject Scheme, and other types of DITA maps.

section.title: DITA Map Pane
section.p: includes a DITA Map pane that presents a DITA map as a hierarchical tree. You can also use this to open any of the topics or submaps within its hierarchy. For more details, see .

section.title: DITA Map Toolbar Actions
section.p: The following DITA map-related actions are readily available on the toolbar when editing a DITA map document:

dlentry.dt: DITA Map Display Mode Drop-Down Menu

dd.p: This drop-down menu offers three possibilities for choosing how the DITA map is displayed:

dlentry.dd: Display the map with the topic references shown.
Displays the map with both titles and topic references shown.

Displays the map with all of the topic content expanded in one document without having to open each topic individually to see the content. This mode is helpful for previewing the entire content of a DITA map.By default, to prevent performance issues, the View Topic Content mode is not available if the DITA map contains more than 250 references. This amount can be configured with the topic.content.refs.limit option.

dlentry.dt: Edit Topic Content (BETA) [For Git Integrations][Available in Project Workspaces]
dlentry.dd: Displays the map with all of the topic content expanded in one document. Unlike View Topic Content, the topic content is editable. When editing a DITA map in this mode, the editor provides actions for both editing topic content and editing map content. When you commit or save the map, all the modified topics are also saved. For more information, see Edit DITA Map Content in One Document.
Opens a dialog box where you can choose the name and value for a variable and inserts the variable definition at the current position within the map.
Inserts an empty relationship table at the current position.
Inserts a new table row with empty cells. The action is available when the cursor position is inside a relationship table.
Inserts a new table column with empty cells after the current column. The action is available when the cursor position is inside a relationship table.
Deletes the table column where the cursor is located.
Deletes the table row where the cursor is located.
Moves the selected node up one position on its same level.
Moves the selected node down one position on its same level.

Moves the selected node up one level to the level of its parent node.When promoting a node in a bookmap, the node type may change to prevent validation errors. For example, a promoted topicref is changed to a chapter.

Moves the selected node down one level to the level of its child nodes.When demoting a node in a bookmap, the node type may change to prevent validation errors. For example, a demoted chapter is changed to a topicref.

section.title: DITA Map Contextual Menu Actions
section.p: There are various actions that are available in the contextual menu when editing DITA map documents:

dd.p: This submenu includes the following insert actions that are specific to the DITA Map framework:

dlentry.dd: Opens a dialog box where you can choose the name and value for a variable and inserts the variable definition at the current position within the map.

dlentry.dt: Relationship Table submenu (Available when invoked on a relationship table)
dlentry.dd: Presents various actions for configuring the relationship table, such as adding or deleting rows and columns.
Opens the CSS Inspector pane that displays information about the CSS styles that are applied to the currently selected element.

section.title: Special Icons
section.p:
There are a few special icons that are displayed in DITA maps next to topic references that contain certain attributes set to no:
- This icon is displayed if a topic reference has the toc attribute set to no.
- This icon is displayed if a topic reference has the print attribute set to no.
